description: From Latin repudiātus, from repudiō (“I cast off, reject”), from repudium (“divorce”), 1540s.

verbs.description: repudiate (third-person singular simple present repudiates, present participle repudiating, simple past and past participle repudiated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To reject the truth or validity of; to deny.
(transitive) To refuse to have anything to do with; to disown.
examples: Synonyms: disavow, forswear; see also Thesaurus:repudiate

entries.meaning: (transitive) To refuse to pay or honor (a debt).
